locations.name: Adventure Playground
locations.description: Kids build forts with real tools in America's wildest playground
locations.longDescription: One of only 4 adventure playgrounds in the US where kids 7+ build forts with real hammers, saws, and paint, plus a thrilling zip line. Expect dirt, minor scrapes, and major confidence-building in this supervised experience.
parentQuotes: My kids adored that place and despite my worries, never got injured
It builds independence like nowhere else - they come home so proud
Transformative but not for risk-averse families

locations.name: Children's Creativity Museum
locations.description: Kids create stop-motion movies and record music in hands-on studios
locations.longDescription: Interactive museum where kids 2-12 create stop-motion animations, record music in professional studios, and explore STEAM activities. The Animation Studio is consistently rated as the top favorite by parents.
parentQuotes: The Animation Studio had my 6-year-old completely absorbed for 2 hours
Perfect rainy day activity - everything is indoors
My daughter still talks about the music studio months later

locations.name: Tilden Little Farm
locations.description: Working farm with cows, goats, and chickens in the Berkeley hills
locations.longDescription: FREE 70-year-old working farm in Berkeley hills with cows, goats, chickens and seasonal baby animals. Perfect for ages 6 months to 8 years, though animal feeding is temporarily suspended for safety.
parentQuotes: The free admission is amazing for families on a budget
My toddler loves seeing the baby animals in spring
Arrive early - parking fills up fast on weekends

locations.name: Bay Area Discovery Museum
locations.description: STEM exhibits with Golden Gate Bridge views and outdoor adventure areas
locations.longDescription: Spectacular 7.5-acre STEM-focused children's museum at Fort Baker with Golden Gate Bridge views, featuring indoor/outdoor exhibits including the beloved Lookout Cove adventure area and innovative Try It Studio.
parentQuotes: Worth the drive just for the incredible location and views
The Lookout Cove outdoor area is pure magic for kids
Recent renovation made it feel like a completely new museum

locations.name: Happy Hollow Park & Zoo
locations.description: Small zoo with gentle rides and playgrounds designed for little ones
locations.longDescription: Beloved 60-year-old combo zoo and amusement park designed for ages 2-7, featuring 150 animals, gentle rides including the newly reimagined Danny the Dragon train, puppet shows, and multiple playgrounds.
parentQuotes: The all-inclusive admission is such great value
Danny the Dragon ride is always the highlight
Perfect size for young kids - not overwhelming like bigger parks
seasonalInfo: Some outdoor exhibits close in rain
recentUpdates: Danny the Dragon ride completely reimagined 2024
